page.title: 05PLAYGROUND GAMES (1) HEMEL
page.content: At Maylands Junior School there are 2 playgrounds and a large field. One playground is used chiefly by boys for {football,}the other by girls and boys. Boys often play{British bulldog}or {"it".}In summer they play{cricket, {tennis}and{kiss chase.}They rarely play{marbles}or{conkers}in school. Girls play a huge variety of organised games in groups of 3 to 12, usually involving rhymes (often with a story line).{French skipping}has phases of popularity (not seasonal) and ordinary{skipping}and{odd-man-out {games}are always popular. Both sexes play{imagination games with toys associated with TV and Space stories.
